metadata.title: CVE-2018-20340 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: Yubico libu2f-host 1.1.6 contains unchecked buffers in devs.c, which could enable a malicious token to exploit a buffer overflow. An attacker could use this to attempt to execute malicious code using a crafted USB device masquerading as a security token on a computer where the affected library is currently in use. It is not possible to perform this attack with a genuine YubiKey.

notes.note: sbeattie> requires libpam-u2f setup or other yubikey based software applications. Browser U2F implmentations are NOT affected.

criterions.comment: libu2f-host package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.1.7-1').
